\maketitle\abstracts{
Data collected with the ALEPH detector at centre-of-mass energies
between 130 and 189 GeV are used to search for Higgs bosons
of the standard model and its supersymmetric extensions.
No evidence for a Higgs particle has been found in 256 \ipb\ of LEP2 data.
Mass exclusion limits were set.
}

\section{Introduction}\label{sec:intro}

A neutral Higgs boson is required to complete the particle spectrum
of the standard model. Fits to electroweak data~\cite{EWWG99}
from LEP, SLC and Tevatron indicate that
if the Higgs particle exists it has most probably a mass around 100 \gevcc.
